title.narrative: Swedish Prison and Probation Service phase II

description.narrative: The project objectives are: 1. Improved and sustainable service delivery, in compliance with relevant human rightsstandards, within the Prison and Probation services based on an individual risk andneeds approach.2. Increased awareness and promotion of alternative sanctions contributing to reduceprison overcrowding.3. Strengthened interdepartmental collaboration between Kenya Prison Service (KPS) andKenya Probation and Aftercare Service (KPAS) facilitating coordinated approaches forprofessional treatment of offenders.

Projektet är en fortsättning på "The strengthening of prison and probation practices project in Kenya 2015- 2018" och har skapats i nära samarbete mellan svenska kriminalvården (SPPS), Kenya Prison Service (KPS) och Kenya Probation and Aftercare Service (KPAS). Målet är att fortsätta den institutionella kapacitetsuppbyggnaden för att förbättra institutionella kapaciteten för mer professionell, human och säker verksamhet baserad på internationella standarder. Projektet, som är en roll-out och exit fas, är planerat att genomföras under tre år, 1 juli 2019 till 30 juni 2022 och den föreslagna budgeten uppgår till 22,5 miljoner kronor.
Insatsens tre programmål är: 1. Förbättrad och hållbar serviceleverans inom fängelse- och frivårdstjänsterna i Kenya, i enlighet med relevanta mänskliga rättigheter standarder, samt baserade på individuell risk och behovsbedömningar. 2. Ökad medvetenhet och användandet av alternativa påföljder som bidrar till att minska överbeläggningen på de kenyanska fängelserna. 3. Stärkt samarbete mellan Kenya Prison Service (KPS) och Kenya Probation and Aftercare Service (KPAS) som bidrar till professionell behandling av brottslingar.
Programmet är en gemensam insats mellan Sverige och Kenya där Sverige står för den direkta finansieringen av programaktiviteter medan Kenya ställer personer, lokaler, transporter mm till förfogande inom programmets ram. Det kommer att ledas gemensamt av Kriminalvården, KPS och KPAS under en ledningsgrupp bestående av två kenyanska programansvariga, två svenska rådgivare och en i Sverige-baserad programansvarig. Kriminalvården kommer att förse programmet med expertis och utbildare. Samarbete och samordning kommer att ske med Raoul Wallenberg Institutets (RWI), Sida-stödda program för att stärka den kenyanska kriminalvårdens respekt för mänskliga rättigheter.

This project is a continuation of "The strengthening of prison and probation practices project in Kenya 2015- 2018" and has been created in close co-operation between the Swedish Prison and Probation Service (SPPS), Kenya Prison Service (KPS) and Kenya Probation and Aftercare Service (KPAS). The objective is to continue the institutional capacity building to improve service delivery for more professional, humane and safe operations based on international standards. This roll-out and exit phase is planned to be carried out during a period of three years, 1st July 2019 to 30th June 2022 and the proposed budget amounts to 22,5 million SEK.
The project have the following intermediate outcomes: 1. Improved and sustainable service delivery, in compliance with relevant human rights standards, within the Prison and Probation services based on an individual risk and needs approach. 2. Increased awareness and promotion of alternative sanctions contributing to reduce prison overcrowding. 3. Strengthened interdepartmental collaboration between Kenya Prison Service (KPS) and Kenya Probation and Aftercare Service (KPAS) facilitating coordinated approaches for professional treatment of offenders.
The project will be a joint undertaking by SPPS, KPS and KPAS under the leadership of a Programme Management Team (PMT) consisting of two Kenyan National Programme Managers, two Swedish Correction Advisors and one coordinating Swedish Project Manager. SPPS will also to some extent also in this phase provide the project with experts and trainers in relevant areas. Sida will be the sole funder of the programme. The project will be coordinated with the Raoul Wallenberg Institute project to strengthen the Human Rights in Kenyan Prisons also supported by Sida for the period 2015-2019.

tag.narrative: 10.3 - Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.

10.3 - Säkerställa lika möjligheter och minska förekomsten av ojämlika utfall, bland annat genom att avskaffa diskriminerande lagstiftning, politik och praxis och främja lagstiftning, politik och åtgärder av lämpligt slag i detta hänseende.

16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.

title.narrative: Agreement - Strengthening Prison & Probation Service Phase II

description.narrative: No activities have actually taken place since the last CoP. The contribution is suffering serious delays due to political reasons on the Kenyan side as well as the entry of covid onto the global scene. First there was hesitation from the Treasury to sign the agreement with the Embassy as the new PS had not vouched for or recommended it. She was not content with how the process and project had been handled, although everything was ready for signing in the summer of 2019. She had to be presented with new approaches and working methods in order to come on board. When she finally did, it took a long time for the Treasury to actually sign the agreement, since they also had some ideas of how the Kenyan contribution should be presented in the agreement. In the meantime, the covid pandemic struck and the officers from SPPS left for Sweden. Once the agreement was signed in the late fall of 2020, the planning of officers returning to Kenya commenced. One arrived in Januari 2021, ready to get the project on track. It then turned out that the signing of agreements between the cooperating parties in the project, was not clear. New rules applied, that the PS should be the Kenyan signatory with SPPS instead of Kenya Prison Service (KPS) andKenya Probation and Aftercare Service (KPAS). Not everyone is in full agreement on this on the Kenyan side, hence the commencing of activities is further delayed. At this point in time, it is unclear how this will be solved and when.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
